title: Withdrawing Life Support
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Withdrawing Life Support.

hook.text: A patient is brain-dead on a ventilator. The family says 'keep going.' The doctors say 'it's over.' Who's right?

buildup.text: Life support can sustain breathing and heartbeat long after the brain has irreversibly stopped functioning.

discovery.text: Brain death is legal death in most countriesâ€”even though the body appears alive on a ventilator.

twist.text: Families often struggle to accept brain death because the patient looks like they're sleeping, not dead.

climax.text: Withdrawing support isn't killing the patientâ€”it's acknowledging that death has already occurred.

punchline.text: Machines can sustain a body. They can't restore a person.

quiz.question: Why do families struggle with accepting brain death?
options: The patient appears to be sleeping because machines maintain body functions
